intro: Baryxylum africanum, commonly known as the African baryxylum, is a flowering plant native to sub-Saharan Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and showy, five-petaled flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in savanna and woodland habitats. Baryxylum africanum is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
